description: The sum of consecutive Fibonacci numbers.
comments: Also the difference of two Fibonacci numbers because the difference F(i+2) - F(j+1) equals the sum F(j) + ... + F(i). - _T. D. Noe_, Oct 17 2005; corrected by _Patrick Capelle_, Mar 01 2008
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
crossrefs: Cf. A113188 (primes that are the difference of two Fibonacci numbers).
Cf. A219114 (numbers whose squares are here).
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 02 2000
